issues.reason: It assumes, without proof, that pure-H isotropy objects in Sp^G_O are equivalent to W_G(H)-spectra and that O-regular slice generators correspond exactly to ordinary connectivity generators. This is a central, nontrivial claim in the incomplete-transfer context.
issues.required_fix: Give a precise theorem/citation valid for Sp^G_O, or prove the equivalence and explicitly track images of O-regular cells to obtain the exact cutoff ceil(n/|H|).

issues.reason: The induction uses proper-subgroup cells G_+ \wedge_J (...) coming from S(bar rho_H). For incomplete transfer systems, such J need not be in A_O, so these are not guaranteed O-slice generators and the induction can fail.
issues.required_fix: Either add and prove the needed closure hypothesis on A_O (e.g., subgroup closure) or replace the proof with one that uses only admissible subgroups and still proves tau_n^O = Sigma^-1 bar tau_{n+1}^O.

issues.reason: Existence/properties of E F for the specific families F_{<r}, F_{<=r} inside Sp^G_O are asserted but not justified; these collections may fail family-closure requirements. The decomposition of Q_r into pure conjugacy-class layers is also unproved.
issues.required_fix: Define admissible families precisely in this model, prove these F are allowed, construct E F and its geometric fixed-point behavior in Sp^G_O, and justify the pure-isotropy splitting used in the induction.

issues.reason: The jump from generator checks plus closure of C_n to all of bar tau_n^O \cap Sp_{>=0} uses an unproved 'connective cellular generation' statement. Intersecting a localizing subcategory with connective objects is subtle.
issues.required_fix: Prove the required connective generation statement or give an alternative argument that avoids this intersection issue (for example, a localizing argument in the ambient category plus a separate connective truncation step).

residual_concerns: Lemma 1 suppresses residual Weyl-action details; even if connectivity survives, the exact fixed-point formula should be stated in the correct equivariant form.

issues.reason: The claim "if H->G is admissible and J<=H then J->G is admissible" is generally false for incomplete transfer/indexing systems. The pullback/truncation argument given is invalid (closure is not under arbitrary pullback from non-admissible domains). Therefore the filtration argument for S(bar{rho}_H) in Lemma 7 can use non-admissible J-cells, so tau_n^O = Sigma^{-1} bar{tau}_{n+1}^O is not established.
issues.required_fix: Either add an explicit extra hypothesis that admissible subgroups are downward closed under inclusion, or replace Lemma 7 with a correct theorem/proof of the shift identity valid for the chosen incomplete model (with precise citation and hypotheses), and rework part (2) accordingly.

issues.reason: These are invoked as model-dependent facts without precise theorem statements/references. In the incomplete O-stable setting, existence of the stated Gamma_U/L_U formulas and identification of the one-class quotient with Sp^{W_G(H)} are nontrivial and essential for the reverse implication.
issues.required_fix: Specify the exact model of Sp^G_O and cite theorem numbers (or provide proofs) that give: (i) downward-closed isotropy recollement with the stated geometric fixed-point behavior, and (ii) equivalence of the pure-[H] quotient to W_G(H)-spectra with the claimed image of regular cells.

residual_concerns: Clarify the convention for Loc(-) (slice-localizing vs triangulated localizing). The argument in Lemma 5 relies on the slice-localizing convention.

issues.reason: The induction hypothesis is stated for connective objects, but it is applied to A = Γ_{U_{j-1}}X without proving A is connective. So the induction, as written, is not formally valid.
issues.required_fix: Either prove that Γ_U (and the needed localization pieces) preserve equivariant connectivity, or restate/prove Lemma 8 without a connective hypothesis by proving the pure-stratum cutoff lemmas in full generality.

issues.reason: The central claim Loc{Σ^mR | m≥r} = (Mod_R)_{≥r}, and its translation to conn(UΦ^H(-)), is asserted but not justified under the stated slice-localizing convention (not Σ^{-1}-closed). This is the key step producing the floor/ceiling bounds.
issues.required_fix: Provide an explicit proof or precise citation that for connective R = Σ^∞_+W_G(H), the slice-localizing closure of shifts m≥r equals the connective aisle, and that under the one-class equivalence UΦ^H is the underlying-spectrum functor creating that t-structure.

residual_concerns: Lemma 3 should use the precise Weyl/double-coset indexing set; likely harmless for connectivity, but the exact equivalence statement should be corrected.

issues.reason: The step "F_H corresponds to the underlying-spectrum functor U_R" is not proved. Showing agreement on the compact generator as a spectrum is insufficient: a colimit-preserving functor Mod_{R_H} -> Sp is classified by F(R_H) as a right R_H-module, and the right R_H-action on F_H(P_H) is not identified.
issues.required_fix: Compute/identify the right R_H-module structure on F_H(P_H) induced by End(P_H), and prove it is the regular module. Then conclude (via Morita/Eilenberg-Watts) that F_H is naturally equivalent to U_R.

issues.reason: Recollement and the one-class quotient equivalence are invoked abstractly without precise theorem-level citations or explicit hypothesis checks in the incomplete transfer-system model.
issues.required_fix: Add exact references (with theorem numbers) for incomplete isotropy recollement and pure-stratum Morita equivalence, and verify all assumptions in this setting.

residual_concerns: When applying pure-cutoff lemmas inside the induction, explicitly state the identification of T_n intersect pure-[H] stratum with the corresponding localizing subcategory in the quotient model.

issues.reason: The module-action identification is not formally pinned down: left/right module conventions are ambiguous ("equivalently opposite depending on convention"), and the Eilenberg–Watts formula is written with side conventions that are not consistent as stated. Therefore the claimed equivalence F_H|_{Q_H} ≃ U_{R_H} is not actually proved.
issues.required_fix: Choose a single module convention (left or right) and stick to it; compute End(P_H) with the correct opposite ring; explicitly identify the induced action on F_H(P_H) as the regular module in that convention; then re-run Eilenberg–Watts with the correct tensor orientation/bimodule structure to conclude F_H|_{Q_H} ≃ underlying-spectrum functor.

issues.reason: The argument applies the pure-layer cutoff in the quotient Q_H to conclude B ∈ \bar\tau_n^O in the ambient category, but the needed compatibility statement between ambient filtration pieces and quotient/local objects is not explicitly proved.
issues.required_fix: Add a lemma showing that for local/pure [H]-layer objects, membership in \bar\tau_n^O is equivalent to membership of their quotient image in the subcategory generated by the corresponding shifted R_H-cells; justify via exactness of localization and identification of images of regular slice generators.

issues.reason: Citations are listed, but hypothesis verification for the incomplete-transfer orbital category is asserted at a high level rather than checked theorem-by-theorem. This leaves a foundational gap for recollement and one-stratum quotient use.
issues.required_fix: For each cited theorem/proposition, explicitly state required assumptions and verify them for \mathcal M_{\mathcal O} (finiteness, orbital/epiorbital structure, lower-ideal condition, etc.), then state the exact transported conclusions used later.

residual_concerns: The connective hypothesis on X is not used in the presented converse; either show where it is needed or state the stronger theorem without that assumption.
